description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Given the current situation, if everyone fishes more than 10 tons, the lake population will shrink next month.
Kate wanted to catch 0 tons of fish, and caught 0 tons.

The group of fishermen discussed the importance of making thoughtful decisions for the long-term health of the lake and agreed to establish a communication system to share the current population size before each month's fishing season to optimize their individual incomes while maintaining a healthy population of fish.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly fishing report. John caught 5 tons of fish. Kate caught 0 tons of fish. Jack caught 20 tons of fish. Emma caught 5 tons of fish. Luke caught 5 tons of fish.
John

It looks like Jack had a productive month. I'm glad we were able to maintain a decent population of fish in the lake despite Jack's large catch. Kate and Emma, how did you decide on your catch amounts this month?
Kate

I'm glad we were all able to make thoughtful decisions this month, Kate and Emma. I know it can be tempting to catch more when the opportunity arises, but it's important to consider the long-term health of the lake. Jack, your large catch this month will certainly help boost your income, but I'm curious if you have any plans to adjust your strategy in the coming months to ensure a sustainable population of fish.
Jack

I agree with Kate, Jack. It's crucial that we all consider the long-term health of the lake. I'm glad we've all been making thoughtful decisions so far. For my part, I plan to continue catching a moderate amount each month to help maintain a healthy population. I'm open to discussing potential strategies with all of you to ensure the sustainability of our fishery.
Luke

I'm glad we're all committed to making thoughtful decisions for the long-term health of the lake. I also plan to catch a moderate amount each month to help maintain a healthy population. I'd be open to discussing potential strategies to ensure the sustainability of our fishery, such as implementing a rotating catch limit or coordinating our catch amounts based on the current population size.
Kate

I completely agree with all of you that we need to prioritize the long-term health of the lake. I'm also open to discussing potential strategies to ensure sustainability. One idea could be to establish a communication system where we share the current population size before each month's fishing season, and adjust our catch amounts accordingly. This way, we can work together to maintain a healthy population and optimize our individual incomes.
Emma

I completely agree with all of you that communication and collaboration are key to ensuring the long-term health and sustainability of our fishery. I'd be happy to help facilitate a system for sharing the current population size before each month's fishing season. This way, we can make informed decisions about our catch amounts and work together to maintain a healthy population and optimize our individual incomes.
John

I'm glad we're all on the same page when it comes to prioritizing the long-term health of the lake and collaborating to optimize our individual incomes. I propose that we establish a regular communication channel, such as a group chat or email thread, where we can share the current population size before each month's fishing season. This way, we can make informed decisions about our catch amounts and work together to maintain a healthy population and maximize our earnings.
Kate

I completely agree with John's proposal. A regular communication channel will help us make informed decisions and work together to maintain a healthy population and optimize our individual incomes. I'll make sure to share the current population size before each month's fishing season.
Emma

I'm glad we've all come to an agreement on the importance of communication and collaboration to ensure the long-term health and sustainability of our fishery. I'll make sure to share the current population size before each month's fishing season as well. Let's continue to work together to optimize our individual incomes while maintaining a healthy population of fish in the lake.
